titleStmt.title: King Edward the Third, with the fall of Mortimer, Earl of March an historicall play, as it is acted at the Theatre-Royall by Their Majesties servants.
titleStmt.author: Bancroft, John, d. 1696.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A30788 of text R8063 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing B635). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

titleStmt.title: King Edward the Third, with the fall of Mortimer, Earl of March an historicall play, as it is acted at the Theatre-Royall by Their Majesties servants.
titleStmt.author: Bancroft, John, d. 1696.
Mountfort, William, 1664?-1692.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Hindmarsh ... R. Bently ... A. Roper ... and Randall Taylor ...,

notesStmt.note: The dedication is signed Will. Mountfort, and states that the play was a present to him. It was included in "Six plays written by Mr. Mountfort," 1720, the editor stating that though "not wholly composed by him, he had at least a share in fitting it for the stage." Coxeter states that it was written by John Bancroft and given by him to Mountfort. Cf. DNB; BM (new ed.), and Nicoll, A. History of restoration drama, 1940, p. 158.
Published in 1731 under title: The fall of Mortimer. Reviv'd from Mountfort, with alterations.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.

keywords.term: Edward -- III, -- King of England, 1312-1377 -- Drama.
